Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies will start the National League Division Series on Saturday, with Zack Wheeler set to pitch Game 1.
The team is considering their postseason rotation order and may wait until they know who their opponent is before choosing a Game 2 starter.
Manager Rob Thomson wants to lean on the Phillies' bullpen in the postseason, but also wants to keep pushing their starters to reach 200 innings.
The Phillies are factoring in the home and road performance of their pitchers, with Cristopher SÃ¡nchez having a 2.21 ERA at home and a 5.02 ERA on the road.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies have played 30 postseason games in the last two years, with their starter going six innings in 12 of them.
The team has accounted for 28 percent of the postseason starts that lasted six innings from 2022-23.
There is a growing sentiment across the sport that relievers face their own penalty if a lineup sees them a lot during a postseason series.
Others: The Phillies are considering their roster for the NLDS, with Austin Hays' role still uncertain due to injuries.
The team may opt to keep Max Lazar or Spencer Turnbull on the roster for their bullpen depth.
Kody Clemens, who spent the first three months of the 2023 season with the Phillies, will have a spot on the roster this time around.
